items.sentence: Tom tried on many hats, but he couldn\'t find one that fit.

I only talked to Tom when there was no one else to talk to.

Tom certainly didn\'t approve of the way Mary was behaving.
Tom certainly doesn\'t have a very good sense of direction.
Tom certainly manages to make everybody thinks he\'s happy.
Tom and Mary told me they\'re thinking about getting a dog.
My brother didn\'t like her from the first time he met her.
Everyone kept the surprise birthday party for Tom a secret.
I assume that was the only way to get the job done in time.

Tom came up to me after class and asked me a few questions.

How do you know you aren\'t mistaking me for somebody else?
Tom washed these apples, but didn\'t wash those over there.
Tom\'s mother lives in Boston. His father lives in Chicago.

Tom took Mary\'s empty glass from her hand and refilled it.
Tom wished he had more time to do things with his children.
